channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: @jessegrosjean @chriseidhof @WorkFlowy @checkvist_news I'm glad to see you're supporting OPML as a native file format. We should test to see if it interops my Drummer, my latest outliner, whose native format is OPML. https://t.co/jBvvd07MwT
Hackers can steal your Tesla Model 3, Y using new Bluetooth attack. https://t.co/tKzbaxQhkf

@phonetonote Maybe a subset of this will prove useful? A plug-in that creates an OPML version of your current outline that can then be plugged into anything that handles OPML, fir example every RSS reader.
A Quarter Of All EV Chargers Don't Work, Half Of Car Trips Are Less Than 3 Miles. https://t.co/grUr9EF1pg
@sistermedia Would you like me to block you?

Okay Leon Muks is a Republican. Someone should find out if he's anti-abortion. He should probably go into hiding for a while. I liked him better when I didn't know he's a fascist.
One more thing..
ðŸ’©
@jeremyzilar You have one of these??

So I bought an expensive Bose speaker to play Alexa, and the thing delegates to other Alexas in my house. If I say "Alexa WNYC" nothing comes out of the Bose speaker but the other three Alexas in my house start playing WNYC. And the sound is kind of like the $40 speaker I bought.
It took 1/2 hour to set up and update, and I had to give it access to everything just to get to Hello World, and after a couple of minutes, I think it's going back.
@bruces OK to repost this pic?

I just bought an expensive product from Bose. But before it'll do anything I have to create an account. It seems that should have been in their advertising.
And now it's updating itself. Oy. They need to work on the instant gratification thing.

@verycoolhacker I like that OPML is its native file format. Same with https://t.co/jBvvd07MwT The two apps should be able to work on the same files. Very nice! I wish my friends in #toolsforthought world would do that too. ;-)
Elon Musk Says He'll Vote Republican in 'This Election.' https://t.co/bTuXXsMCw5
Elon Musk Does Not Care About Spam Bots. https://t.co/hJhQUFQoWW
@New_Tape_City We act unruly because weâ€™re from NY.
@trickjarrett that's what i figured ;-)
Whatâ€™s Down the Road for Silicon? https://t.co/tAh6LX3G65
I've stopped doing Wordle. I start, and then I get to the third guess and think of something I'd rather do.
@djlk exactly. and you wonder why people were so generous, and i think it's because it's what we do. ;-)
@tad exactly

If Twitter had a Steve Jobs type leader he'd come up with a brilliant idea, akin to noise-cancelling headphones (and call it that), and explain how satisfying it can be to tell the trolls to shut the fuck up. Ahhhh nice and quiet.
I used to live on noisy streets in Palo Alto and Berkeley.
I moved to NYC, even worse (I lived in the west village, then the east village) until I moved uptown and then ahhh nice and quiet.
Moved to the mountains, even better!
There's something to be said for a little peace.
Here's how I made my twtr quiet. At the first sign of trollish behavior, I mute or block. Works great.
The trollish behavior is basically anyone who wants to argue with you. People who say unfair things and you want to point out how unfair they are.
If you find yourself protesting, the chances you're communicating with a troll approach 100 percent.
To determine if the person conversing with you is a troll, look at your own feelings. If you feel they misunderstand you and want to correct them -- it's a troll.
We've learned so much about trolls.
Trolls aren't nearly as frustrating as newbies who refuse to turn them off and insist on setting them straight FOR ALL TO SEE.
Ohhh, that's exactly what they want.
And btw, in 2022, the entire Republican Party platform is trolling.
Whoever runs Twitter needs the sass of Steve Jobs with his incredible ability to make simple ideas simple.
Noise-cancelling headphones for Twitter.
Instead of focusing on trying to diminish the brightness of the sun, give everyone sunglasses.
I think I'll add another tweet.
A Repub is someone who likes to troll Libs.
A Lib is someone who thinks Repubs want to know why they're wrong.
One of the coolest things about the web is that people do tutorials with videos showing how they do things like install a new antenna on your roof, or put together an Adirondack chair. When people bad mouth the web, they forget about miracles like that.
That said, there must be videos that demo how to shut down the trolls yourself.
@AndreaDMorgan because i'm a hopeful person and if he was not only smart as he clearly is, if his intentions were good, there would be a lot of good he could do.

I've hoped that even though Elon Musk was a partner of Peter Thiel in Paypal, that he didn't have the same disgusting nazi-like politics as Thiel. Give him the benefit of the doubt. Hope for the best. But it's becoming harder to give him that benefit.

1/4 Software is easy to debug if you treat it like anything else.
2/4 If you have what you think is a bad light bulb, but when you put a new bulb in the socket it doesn't work, you'd conclude the problem was in the socket, not the bulb.
3/4 (Although it doesn't hurt to try a third bulb from a different pack if possible. Sometimes two bulbs are broken.)
4/4 Debugging a problem in software is usually just a series of those kinds of tests.
Jordan Peterson announces he is 'departing' Twitter. https://t.co/kqx3Y1VMvq
